t: The Idols of Babylon and the One True God
Bel*pn bows down; Nebo stoops; their*ld idols are on beasts and livestock; these*ln things you carry are borne as*ld burdens on weary beasts.
They*ln stoop; they bow down together; they*ld cannot save the burden, but*ld themselves go into captivity.
“Listen*pn to me, O house of Jacob, all*ld the remnant of the house of Israel, who*ln have been borne by me from before your birth, carried*ld from the womb;
even*ln to your old age I am he, and*ld to gray hairs I will carry you. I*ln have made, and I will bear; I*ld will carry and will save.
“To*pn whom will you liken me and make me equal, and*ld compare me, that we may be alike?
Those*ln who lavish gold from the purse, and*ld weigh out silver in the scales, hire*ln a goldsmith, and he makes it into a god; then*ld they fall down and worship!

They*ln lift it to their shoulders, they carry it, they*ld set it in its place, and it stands there; it*ld cannot move from its place. If*ln one cries to it, it does not answer or*ld save him from his trouble.
“Remember*pn this and stand firm, recall*ld it to mind, you transgressors,
remember*ld the former things of old; for*ln I am God, and there is no other; I*ld am God, and there is none like me,
declaring*ln the end from the beginning and*ld from ancient times things not yet done, saying,*ln ‘My counsel shall stand, and*ld I will accomplish all my purpose,’
calling*ln a bird of prey from the east, the*ld man of my counsel from a far country. I*ln have spoken, and I will bring it to pass; I*ld have purposed, and I will do it.
“Listen*pn to me, you stubborn of heart, you*ld who are far from righteousness:
I*ln bring near my righteousness; it is not far off, and*ld my salvation will not delay; I*ln will put salvation in Zion, for*ld Israel my glory.”
